Package ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers

Class EventController

java.lang.Object
ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers.EventController
@RequestMapping("/events") @RestController public class EventController extends Object
Event Controller that implements the Event-API
Author:
Faraj

  • Method Details

    • getAllEvents

      @RequestMapping(method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Event>> getAllEvents() throws DaoException
      This method get all events from the Sql dataBase
      Returns:
      list of events from the DB. or,
      Throws:
      DaoException - if there is a error to get 'events' list or not found.

    • addEvent

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, path="/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addEvent(@RequestBody Event event, @PathVariable Integer userId)
      This method add a new event to the DataBase.
      Parameters:
      event - : The body of the new event.
      userId - : a key that shows for whom the event belong.
      Returns:
      a new event, or get a error message if add event is fail.

    • updateEvent

      @RequestMapping(method=PUT) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateEvent(@RequestBody Event event, @RequestParam Integer userId, @RequestParam Integer eventId)
      This method updates the a event using his id.
      Parameters:
      event - : The updated body of the event.
      userId - : key to update and save the updated user of event.
      userId - : key to update and save the updated event.
      Returns:
      a updated new or a error message if update event is fail.

    • getEventById

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/byId/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEventById(@PathVariable Integer id)
      This method get the event that have this id number
      Parameters:
      id - : the key to search and get the event.
      Returns:
      the event that have this id, or error message if searching for user is fail to get.

    • getUserEvents

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/byUserId/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUserEvents(@PathVariable Integer userId)
      This method get all events of an user by user id
      Parameters:
      userId - : the key to get the user from DB
      Returns:
      the events that have this belong to this user id.

    • getEventsByCategoryId

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/byCategoryId/{categoryId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEventsByCategoryId(@PathVariable Integer categoryId)
      This method get the events that have category Id.
      Parameters:
      categoryId - : a key to get the events from this type
      Returns:
      the events by the category id Enum

    • getEventsByCategoryName

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/byCategoryName/{categoryName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEventsByCategoryName(@PathVariable String categoryName)
      This method get the events that have category name.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - : a key to get the events from this type
      Returns:
      the events by the category name Enums: TASK, WEDDING, VACATION, BIRTHDAY, VOLUNTEERING or GENERAL;

    • getFutureEventsOfUser

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/futureEvents/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getFutureEventsOfUser(@PathVariable Integer userId)
      This method get upcoming events of a user (only future events)
      Parameters:
      id - : the key to get the user from DB
      Returns:
      all the upcoming future events for the current user. or,
      Throws:
      DaoException - if searching for events is fail to get.

    • getUserEventsInDateRange

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/userEventsRange/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUserEventsInDateRange(@PathVariable Integer userId, @RequestParam @DateTimeFormat(iso=DATE_TIME) LocalDateTime startDate, @RequestParam @DateTimeFormat(iso=DATE_TIME) LocalDateTime endDate)
      This method get events of a user in a range between start date and time to end date and time.
      Parameters:
      userId - : the key to get the user from DB
      startDate - : in format of '2022-09-01T00:00'
      startDate - : also in format of '2022-09-01T00:00'
      Returns:
      all events that have this user in this dateTime range. or, get a error message if searching for events is failed.

    • getAllEventsInDateRange

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/allEventsRange") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllEventsInDateRange(@RequestParam @DateTimeFormat(iso=DATE_TIME) LocalDateTime startDate, @RequestParam @DateTimeFormat(iso=DATE_TIME) LocalDateTime endDate)
      This method get all events in a range between start date and time to end date and time.
      Parameters:
      startDate - : in format of '2022-09-01T00:00'
      startDate - : also in format of '2022-09-01T00:00'
      Returns:
      all events in this dateTime range. or, get a error message if searching for events is failed.

    • getNextEventsOfUserByHoursMinutes

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/upcomingByTime/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getNextEventsOfUserByHoursMinutes(@PathVariable Integer userId, @RequestParam Integer hours, @RequestParam Integer minutes) throws DaoException
      This method get events of a user the next coming num of minutes and hours.
      Parameters:
      userId - : the key to get the user from DB
      hours - : number of hours for the event.
      minutes - : number of minutes for the event.
      Returns:
      all next events by this inputs. or,
      Throws:
      DaoException - if get a error message if searching for events is failed.

    • getUserEventsByCategoryName

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/userByCategoryName/{userId}/{categoryName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUserEventsByCategoryName(@PathVariable Integer userId, @PathVariable String categoryName)
      This method get all events of user by category name.
      Parameters:
      userId - : the current user
      categoryName - : the type/ category of event that the user interested to get.
      Returns:
      all events of user in the category. or, get a error message if searching for events is failed. The Category Enums: TASK, WEDDING, VACATION, BIRTHDAY, VOLUNTEERING or GENERAL;

    • deleteEventSoftly

      @RequestMapping(method=PUT, path="/softDelete/{eventId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteEventSoftly(@PathVariable Integer eventId)
      This method do a soft delete of the a event using his id.
      Parameters:
      eventId - : the key to get the event from DB
      Returns:
      updated event that have a value = 1 in failed = inActive. or,
      Throws:
      DaoException - if deleting softly of event is fail.

    • deleteEventsListSoftly

      @RequestMapping(method=PUT, path="/softDeleteList") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteEventsListSoftly(@RequestBody List<Integer> eventList)
      This method do a soft delete of a list of events.
      Parameters:
      eventList - : the key to get the event from DB
      Returns:
      updated event that have a value = 1 in failed = inActive. or,
      Throws:
      DaoException - if deleting softly of events list is fail.

    • deleteEventHardly

      @RequestMapping(method=DELETE, path="/hardDelete/{eventId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteEventHardly(@PathVariable Integer eventId)
      This method do a hard delete of the a event using his id.
      Parameters:
      eventId - : the key to get the event from DB
      Returns:
      a message that the delete done or not, and delete event totally from DB. or,
      Throws:
      DaoException - if deleting hardly of event is fail.

    • deleteEventsListHardly

      @RequestMapping(method=DELETE, path="/hardDeleteList") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteEventsListHardly(@RequestBody List<Integer> eventsList)
      This method do a hard delete of a list of events.
      Parameters:
      eventList - : the key to get the event from DB
      Returns:
      a message that the delete done or not, and delete events list totally from DB. or,
      Throws:
      DaoException - if deleting hardly of events list is fail.
